New Records: Angola set a new record for the southern African side by securing two victories at the Africa Cup of Nations, having never secured more than one win at previous editions.
Key Match Events: Gelson scored two goals in the 38' and 42', Mabululu scored in the 66', and Neblu scored for Namibia in the 17'
Pre-Game Insights: Angola's recent inexperience at this stage makes it a level-playing field in Bouake.
Benjamin is not expected to change tack against Angola, with the Brave Warriors boss anticipated to stick with his preferred 4-1-4-1 approach in Saturday's fixture.
Post-Match Reflections: A goal-shy Namibia are likely to suffer AFCON 2023 elimination against an Angola side that have had goals in them from multiple sources all tournament.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Angola's goalscoring prowess in a goal-laden tournament, with their six strikes matching their tally from 2012 (four), 2013 (one) and 2019 (one) combined.
Others: The Brave Warriors secured a historic victory over 2004 champions Tunisia in their tournament opener in Group E, effectively securing their place in Saturday's game as one of the best third-placed sides.
